        public static mp_i_MDP<ga_CellPositionAndContent<Double>,a_CellWorldAction> createMDPForFigure17_3(a_CellWorld<Double> cw)
        Constructs an MDP that can be used to generate the utility values detailed in Fig 17.3.
        Parameters:
        cw - the cell world from figure 17.1.
        Returns:
        an MDP that can be used to generate the utility values detailed in Fig 17.3.

      • createActionsFunctionForFigure17_1

        public static aa_i_ActionsFunction<ga_CellPositionAndContent<Double>,a_CellWorldAction> createActionsFunctionForFigure17_1(a_CellWorld<Double> cw)
        Returns the allowed actions from a specified cell within the cell world described in Fig 17.1.
        Parameters:
        cw - the cell world from figure 17.1.
        Returns:
        the set of actions allowed at a particular cell. This set will be empty if at a terminal state.

      • createTransitionProbabilityFunctionForFigure17_1

        public static mp_i_MDPTransitionProbabilityFunction<ga_CellPositionAndContent<Double>,a_CellWorldAction> createTransitionProbabilityFunctionForFigure17_1(a_CellWorld<Double> cw)
        Figure 17.1 (b) Illustration of the transition model of the environment: the 'intended' outcome occurs with probability 0.8, but with probability 0.2 the agent moves at right angles to the intended direction. A collision with a wall results in no movement.
        Parameters:
        cw - the cell world from figure 17.1.
        Returns:
        the transition probability function as described in figure 17.1.

      • createRewardFunctionForFigure17_1

        public static mp_i_MDPRewardFunction<ga_CellPositionAndContent<Double>> createRewardFunctionForFigure17_1()
        Returns:
        the reward function which takes the content of the cell as being the reward value.
